name: Carl Adolph Agardh
obverse: Bust of Carl Adolph Agardh facing left.
obverse_inscriptions: C. A. AGARDH BOT. PROF. LUND. D. EPISC. CAROLST.
reverse: A Naiad raises out of the water in a sitting position. She is tying a wreath of algae.
reverse_inscriptions: SOCIO ALGOLOGO CELEBERRIMO R. ACAD. SCIENT. SVEC. MDCCCLXVI
references: För efterkommande: Kungl. Vetenskapsakademiens medaljer 1747-2007, 126, p. 278 - 279
Erik Wallers samling av medicinhistoriska medaljer, 8, p. 18 - 19
Överläkarens i Lidköping Erik Wallers samling av minnespenningar och medaljer: "Donerad" (800:-) till Uppsala universitet[sbibliotek] och deponerad i Universitetets myntkabinett, Issue 1, p. 4
description: Carl Adolph Agardh (23 January 1785 in Båstad, Sweden – 28 January 1859 in Karlstad) was a Swedish botanist
specializing in algae, who was eventually appointed bishop of Karlstad.
The reverse of the medal shows a naiad making a wreath of algae in honor of his contributions in this field.
